intro: Junellia echegarayi, commonly known as the Ecuadorian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within cloud forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and hairy. Junellia echegarayi is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique floral morphology.
